text.p: Italian debt markets held the day's gains of around 60 basis points as dealers squared books going into a long weekend in Italy.
Dealers said bond markets were generally a little nervous but had recovered some poise after selling yesterday although volumes were thin as the start of the year got underway.
March Btp futures gained 70 basis points to 128.00 with support at 127.30 and resistance up at the 128.00 area.
The July 2006 Btp was 54 basis points higher at 108.35 and was yielding 7.64 percent with the spread over the benchmark 10-year Bund 169 basis points.
News late Thursday Italy's budget deficit was provisionally 138.50 trillion lire in 1996, way beyond the revised 123 trillion government target, made little dent on sentiment.

Instead, dealers said the market was watching for progress in discussions on settling a long running pay dispute between metal workers and employers. Formal talks are expected to resume with Labour Minister Tiziano Treu on Wednesday.
Then, dealers say, the market is hoping the Bank of Italy with move to ease interest rates, a prospect which is keeping the market buoyant.
